definitions.definition: To emit or impel (something) in pulses or waves .
To give to (something, especially a cell culture ) an ( increased ) amount of a substance , such as a drug or an isotopic label , over a short time .
To operate a food processor on (some ingredient ) in short bursts , to break it up without liquidizing it.

subdefinitions.definition: To apply an electric current or signal that varies in strength to (something).
To manipulate (an electric current, electromagnetic wave , etc.) so that it is emitted in pulses.

definitions.definition: To expand and contract repeatedly , like an artery when blood is flowing though it, or the heart ; to beat , to throb , to vibrate , to pulsate .
examples: Hot blood pulsed through my veins as I grew angrier.
The streets were dark, and all that could be seen was light pulsing from the disco.

definitions.definition: Of an activity , place , or thing : to bustle with energy and liveliness ; to pulsate.

main_definition: ( transitive , also figuratively ) To emit or impel (something) in pulses or waves .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , chiefly biology , chemistry ) To give to (something, especially a cell culture ) an ( increased ) amount of a substance , such as a drug or an isotopic label , over a short time .
( transitive , cooking ) To operate a food processor on (some ingredient ) in short bursts , to break it up without liquidizing it.
( intransitive , chiefly figuratively and literary ) To expand and contract repeatedly , like an artery when blood is flowing though it, or the heart ; to beat , to throb , to vibrate , to pulsate .
( intransitive , figuratively ) Of an activity , place , or thing : to bustle with energy and liveliness ; to pulsate.
